main_definition: Average refers to the typical value or central tendency within a set of values, often calculated as the sum of all values divided by the number of values.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The standard measure of the middle ground between extremes in a range of data points.
meanings_and_examples.example: When comparing test scores, if some students scored 90 and others scored 10, the average would give us an idea of what most students achieved.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The arithmetic mean of a set of numbers.
meanings_and_examples.example: To find the average monthly income for a family, you add up all their incomes and divide by the number of members.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A measure representing the typical performance or quality level within a group or category.
meanings_and_examples.example: The restaurant received an average rating of 4 stars on several review websites.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In sports, it refers to the usual time taken by athletes in completing a certain event.
meanings_and_examples.example: Average running times for marathons can vary based on age and gender.

meanings_and_examples.definition: When referring to salaries, it denotes the middle value of pay rates within a group or sector.
meanings_and_examples.example: The average salary in this industry has increased by 5% over the past year.
